page.title: 01EAST MERSEA ;AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: East Mersea is a small, scattered settlement covering the eastern part of Mersea Island. The island lies near the estuary of the River Colne and is separated from the mainland by a narrow and shallow channel called the Pyefleet Channel. The land is lowlying, the highest point is only 18m a.s.l.,and is mainly drained farmland. There are some limited sandy beaches on the south side but the island is surrounded by extensive mudflats at low tide. The village is served by a single road off the B1025. There are 273 people living in the village in 7 farms and some 90 other dwellings.There is a Post-Office, Grocers' shop,Public-house and a Church.There is a County Council Youth Camp and a privately-owned holiday centre with several hundred caravans and chalets.
